medical_history.chief_complaint: Relapsing babesiosis in an immunocompromised patient.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, an 81-year-old male, developed new onset fatigue associated with hemolytic anemia and thrombocytopenia in February 2015. Initially diagnosed with autoimmune hemolytic anemia, he showed no clinical response to treatment over two months. His hemoglobin nadired at 6.6 g/dl, and he received 8 units of red blood cells. After referral in June 2015, a positive blood smear for Babesia was noted. Treatment with azithromycin and atovaquone led to symptom resolution and clearance of parasites within 1 week, but he later experienced worsening hemolytic anemia with renewed Babesia parasitemia of 0.3%. Treatment with increased doses and additional medications led to normalization of haptoglobin and negative PCR for Babesia DNA.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia, diagnosed in 2008, treated with bendamustine and rituximab.
medical_history.social_history: The patient reported outdoor activities in the Hudson Valley, a Babesia-endemic area, prior to onset, but did not recall a tick bite.
